name: autosome
content:

a chromosome (= a rod-like structure in a cell that contains the chemical patterns that control what an animal or plant is like) other than one that determines the sex of the animal or plant: The nucleus of a human cell contains 22 pairs of autosomes in addition to the sex chromosomes. Distinguishing the sex chromosomes from the autosomes allowed scientists to better understand how an organism's sex characteristics were determined.
More examplesFewer examplesEach autosome in the genome of a dog contains up to 2,000 different genes arranged side by side along the length of the chromosome.
